main event: On October 6, 1957, a round object was observed traveling quickly for about a minute, emitting a strong yellow-orange light before disappearing. The evidence indicates that it was a probable meteor.
interesting points: The sighting took place north of Lakehurst, New Jersey.
The object was described as a round, dimly-yellow-orange object traveling in a northeastern direction.
The observation lasted for approximately 1 minute, during which the object emitted a strong flash of light and then disappeared out of sight.
The report suggests that the evidence indicates a meteor, despite the size and brilliance of the object and the credibility of the observers.
The observers were identified as Loni Strong and Thomas H. Goff, both pilot observers from McGuire Air Force Base.
sighted object: round object emitting strong yellow-orange light
